data.name: RES_frmsetup.caption.rotext
data.value: Terminal Driver Configuration.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.cmdcancel.caption.rotext
data.value: &Cancel

data.name: RES_frmsetup.cmdfinish.caption.rotext
data.value: &Finish

data.name: RES_frmsetup.cmdnext.caption.rotext
data.value: Next >

data.name: RES_frmsetup.cmdprevious.caption.rotext
data.value: < &Previous

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lblnetoralone.caption.rotext
data.value: First, indicate whether you are installing a stand-alone Terminal Controller, or if this seat is part of a Visualtime installation on multiple computers:

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lblnettype.caption.rotext
data.value: Depending on the type of network and the availability of the Visualtime server, one type of connection or another will be used:

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lblservernamedesc.caption.rotext
data.value: If you are unsure of the name, check with your network administrator. Also, make sure you have permissions to access Visualtime components on that server before continuing. The server must be up and running in order to continue.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lblservernameheader.caption.rotext
data.value: Enter here the name of the computer or IP address where the Visualtime server is installed.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltitle.caption.rotext
data.value: Welcome to the Terminal Driver Configuration Wizard.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltitledesc1.caption.rotext
data.value: This wizard will ask you a few simple questions to finish configuring the terminal driver to your needs.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltitledesc3.caption.rotext
data.value: To continue, click Next.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltype1desc.caption.rotext
data.value: Data is continuously read from the terminals and stored in files. Since there is no connection, you must collect these files and copy them manually to the Visualtime server.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltype1desc2.caption.rotext
data.value: For your information, the folder containing the reading files is:

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltype1title.caption.rotext
data.value: If there is no connection, the terminal driver simply stores the data in local files for someone to retrieve manually.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltype2desc.caption.rotext
data.value: Data is continuously read from the terminals and stored in local files. Every so often, an attempt is made to send these local files to the server. If there is a connection and the server is running, they are sent. Otherwise, they are saved locally and the server continues to try again.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltype2desc2.caption.rotext
data.value: You must specify the name of the shared folder on the server where the files will be copied:

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltype2desc3.caption.rotext
data.value: Files are attempted to be sent every:

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltype2desc4.caption.rotext
data.value: 1 minute(s).

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lbltype2title.caption.rotext
data.value: In this situation, the terminal driver works by passing files to a shared folder on the server.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lblwizardsubtitle.caption.rotext
data.value: This wizard allows you to configure terminal driver options.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.lblwizardtitle.caption.rotext
data.value: Visualtime Terminal Driver Configuration.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.optnettype.0.buttoncaption.rotext
data.value: The network is fast and the server is always online.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.optnettype.0.labelcaption.rotext
data.value: If the network is fast (1Mb/s or more) and the server is always running, this is the recommended option.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.optnettype.1.buttoncaption.rotext
data.value: The network is not fast or the server is often down.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.optnettype.1.labelcaption.rotext
data.value: This type of connection is used on slow networks (less than 1Mb/s) and in situations where the Visualtime server is not always running when the Terminal Controller is.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.opttype.0.buttoncaption.rotext
data.value: This position is part of a Visualtime network.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.opttype.0.labelcaption.rotext
data.value: The Terminal Controller will work as another part of Visualtime, sending data from the terminals to the server.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.opttype.1.buttoncaption.rotext
data.value: This position is independent or isolated.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.opttype.1.labelcaption.rotext
data.value: The Terminal Controller will communicate with the terminals and save the data to a file so that it can be collected by the application that uses them or by the user himself.

data.name: RES_frmsetup.txtfoldername.text.rotext
data.value: \\MyServer\MyFolder

data.name: RES_frmsetup.txtserverfolder.text.rotext
data.value: \\MyServer\MyFolder

data.name: RES_frmsetup.txtservername.text.rotext
data.value: MY SERVER

data.name: RES_msg.serverconnectionerror.msg.rotext
data.value: The specified server cannot be accessed.$CR$CRDetails: ${1}

data.name: RES_msg.serverconnectionerror.title.rotext
data.value: Server not available

data.name: RES_msg.serverisnotremote.msg.rotext
data.value: The name indicated is the same as the local computer. You must indicate the name of the remote server where Visualtime is installed.

data.name: RES_msg.serverisnotremote.title.rotext
data.value: Incorrect name

data.name: RES_question.sharedfoldernotfound.description.rotext
data.value: The specified folder is not currently available. Do you want to continue?$CR$CRIf the folder should be accessible, choose No and review the name.$CRIf the name is spelled correctly, but the folder is not currently accessible, choose Yes to continue.

data.name: RES_question.sharedfoldernotfound.title.rotext
data.value: Folder not available at this time.
